Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Grant: Sixth IEEE International Conference on Healthcare Informatics (ICHI 2018)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
This project is to support doctoral student travel and participation in the IEEE International Conference on Healthcare Informatics (ICHI 2018) in New York, New York from June 4-7, 2018. The ICHI2018 conference provides a supportive scientific forum for students focusing on computing, health- and bioinformatics. ICHI2018 provides a forum for expert and peer critique of students' research with the goal of improving their science. Student participants will also have the opportunity to receive networking support and career advice from internationally-recognized experts. Overall, the travel support brings together students with experts who might not otherwise engage with one another and engage in multidisciplinary research targeting science the area of health.

This proposal supports doctoral students by providing a Student Doctoral Consortium focused on encouraging students to learn from peers and experts from multiple perspectives to understand how innovative computing and informatics combine to have the greatest impact in the area of health. In addition, student participation in rapid talks and roundtable discussions provided at the conference enables students to explore their science and evaluate different career paths for researchers in this area. The ICHI2018 conference exposes participants to different disciplinary approaches, supports networking with conference attendees and is designed to support the development of the next generation of scholars in health- and bioinformatics.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Institution.Name: Joan and Sanford I. Weill Medical College of Cornell University
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: WEILL MEDICAL COLLEGE OF CORNELL UNIVERSITY

Performance_Institution.Name: Joan and Sanford I. Weill Medical College of Cornell University

POR.DRECONTENT:
Healthcare informatics is an interdisciplinary research field on the intersection of healthcare and computational science. The field is critical because of the data-driven revolution recently in different areas. Healthcare is a field where a vast amount of data are produced and computational technologies hold great premises to dig insights from the data to help care quality improvement. IEEE International Conference on Healthcare Informatics (ICHI) is a flagship conference from IEEE Computer Science community that provides a forum for researchers in both healthcare and computational science. The ICHI conference in 2018 was taken place in New York, NY with hundreds of prarticipants. The conference features high profile keynote speakers including George Hripsack from Columbia University and Paul Tang from IBM Watson Health, panel discussions with panelists from funding agengies, researchers from both industry and academia, paper and poster presentations from the authors, as well as a doctoral forum. This project provides travel supports for 10 doctoral students to participate the ICHI conference and present their research at the doctoral forum, which offers a great opportunity for these students to share their research, get feedbacks, learn state-of-the-art research from other speakers, as well as social with the professionals in the same research field. This would be helpful for the professional development of the students and thus the healthy growth of the healthcare informatics community.


Last Modified: 10/25/2019
Modified by: Fei Wang
